info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:25PM EDT until July 13 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON...EASTERN BELMONT...OHIO AND MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 724 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shadyside, or near Bellaire, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Wheeling, Moundsville, Martins Ferry, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Warwood, Bethlehem, Triadelphia, Clearview, Shadyside, McMechen, Powhatan Point, Glen Dale, Bridgeport, Benwood, Yorkville, Brookside, Mount Pleasant, Neffs, and Elm Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for damaging winds and frequent lightning. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
